page.title: 06COAL MINING
page.content: Traditionally employment in this area has been centred on coal mining, within an area of five kilometres there are five coal mines, although the number of mines is decreasing and are being replaced by light industries and small businesses. the local coalmine is approximately one hundred years old,and is known as "Deep Navigation".The mine takes it's name from the fact that it is the deepest mine in the South Wales coal field.The total number of men employed in the mine is approximately nine hundred and eighty working a three shift system. Almost all of the total output of coal is used for to supply the power station at Aberthaw approximately forty kilometres away and is transported by rail. A small amount of coal is used to supply the mines employees concessionary coal.
